content: There are a lot of 'The job x86_64-gnu-llvm-8 of your PR failed' messages on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/73566, which is annoying because there is a lot of important discussion there that's being obscured. Is there a way to hide those messages from high-five?
@Joshua Nelson yes, but you likely don't have the power. feel free to link me to PRs to clean up
@Joshua Nelson oops I forgot about this. and then I looked at it and it seems like a lot of work :(
mostly to show the comments in the first place, before being able to hide them
yeah, that's why I didn't ask haha
there's a lot of comments on that PR
maybe we could let bors hide all its comments whenever an @bors command is issued?
IIRC Pietro has mentioned in the past that the API doesn't support hiding comments?
(I've went through and hidden most of the comments on that thread that I'd normally hide)

simulacrum said:

IIRC Pietro has mentioned in the past that the API doesn't support hiding comments?

There's this - https://docs.github.com/en/graphql/reference/mutations#minimizecomment
ah okay, I think it must be that the REST (v3) API doesn't support it
